About
About
Passionate Florida conservation advocate and wildlife educator with exceptional communication skills, dedicated to inspiring others to protect and appreciate our wild spaces. 

Experienced in animal care, public outreach, and education. A proven leader and critical thinker, adept at collaboration, problem-solving, and adapting to new challenges. Seeking a role where I can apply my expertise in conservation communication while continuing to grow professionally and contribute to wildlife and habitat protection efforts.

Julia Lindley

Environmental Educator and Conservation Communicator
Environmental Educator and Conservation Communicator
1mo • Edited • 
 
1 month ago • Edited • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
I’m thrilled to share that I’ve accepted a position with the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission as a Biologist!

When I left teaching English just over a year ago to pursue a career in conservation, I never could have imagined how quickly things would move. Becoming a biologist has been a dream of mine since childhood, and I’m incredibly grateful to finally take this next step. I’m excited to learn and grow in this role, and to contribute to the important work of protecting Florida’s unique wildlife and ecosystems.

Thank you to all the mentors, colleagues, and organizations who have guided and supported me along the way. Here’s to the next chapter!
…more

Hi! I have some exciting news to share. I have been invited to serve as a guest speaker for the Alabama Audubon Society. I will be giving a free virtual program on November 13th about how to get involved in conservation without a science background. If you are interested in attending, please click the registration link below. 

https://lnkd.in/e6t43ST8
